description: According to folklore, this is a waterfall with a bottomless pool. Be careful to not drown and die.
name: Bo Ella
Meemure Camping
description: The only one place to do camping at Meemure with awesome package including 3 meals & 2 adventures
Addu offers a great mix between the rarified resort experience and the chance to mingle with local Maldivian life
name: Addu Atoll
Podi Hoona - The Little Gecko Luxury Campsite
address: Yala National Park, Kirinda - Sithulpawwa road, Thissamaharamaya
description: An incredibly beautiful luxury campsite which is a treat for eco-lovers, birdwatchers, and people who enjoy genuine rusticity.
Escape Colombo is a live 'escape' experience. You can take a bunch of people with you, get locked in a room and try your best to  solve the clues and make it out before the timer runs out.
name: Escape Colombo
The Woods
description: A beautiful cottage hotel that provides the genuine jungle experience nestled in the wilderness of Beragala.
A sea turtle conservation project, which they say is operated by the Wildlife Protection Society of Sri Lanka.
name: Arun and Aman Turtle Conservation and Research Centre

description: One of our most popular outlaw's favourite hideout.
name: Saradiel's Rock (Utuwankanda)

description: Sera falls is a relatively unknown albeit beautiful waterfall. We don't really know much about it.
name: Sera Falls

description: One of the oldest mosques in Colombo, the Red Mosque is also an iconic landmark.
name: Red Mosque (Pettah)
Closenberg Hotel
description: Apparently built among the ruins of a Dutch fortalice, the Closenberg Hotel is an exquisite Colonial structure dating back to the 1800s.
Thudugala Ella is a waterfall located near Kalutara, in an rubber estate once owned by a British. It is quite popular as a fine bathing place.
name: Thudugala Waterfall

description: A lighthouse on a palm-tree filled island near Beruwala.
name: Beruwala Lighthouse

description: Waterfalls with stunning views? Yes please.
name: Aberdeen Falls
Number 11
description: Former home of Geoffrey Bawa (possibly Sri Lanka's most famous contemporary architect)
Established in 2015, Pinnawala Open Zoo is a zoological garden in Sri Lanka. It's the first open-air zoo in Sri Lanka, and acts as an educational and conservation based visitor center.
name: Pinnawala Open Zoo

description: A small beach with great surfing, lots of greenery and some fine establishments for eats and hangs
name: Hiriketiya Beach
Koggala Turtle Hatchery (Habaraduwa)
description: A dingy "turtle farm" catering to tourists who want wildlife photo ops in the South.

name: Pedro Tea Estate (Nuwara Eliya)
description: A charming little tea factory and tea shop just outside Nuwara Eliya.
One of the more heard-about waterfalls in SL as it is the source of hydropower which fuels the Laxapana Powerstation.
name: Laxapana Falls

description: Colombo's only proper museum (the Dutch museum and the weird old Town Hall one barely come on par) is pretty amazing. This Italianate colonial style building houses statues, artifacts and paintings that go back as far as the 5th century.
name: Colombo National Museum

description: The Crow Island Dog Cemetery is a tiny plot near an interesting if neglected beach park in Colombo North. It's quite a trek and not worth it in itself, but if you're interested in the changing Colombo North, it's a nice part of a visit to Crow Island.
name: The Dog Cemetery

description: A curated and ethical Saturday market focusing on local and sustainable products and produce
address: Race Course Ground, Reid Avenue, Colombo 7
name: Good Market (Racecourse)

description: The old Town Hall is a gothic-type Dutch building at the end of Main Street in Pettah. Inside it is a creepy museum of life-size dolls sitting around a wooden table in different postures: a replica of a council meeting in 1906.
name: Old Town Hall
Isha Water Park (Uppuveli)
description: Located in Uppuveli, near the third milepost, lies Isha Water Park (also known as ‘Waves’). An entrance fee of 600/ buys you a day at this perpetually deserted waterpark.

Completed in 1924, the oldest and longest iron bridge in Sri Lanka now lies unused next to a new bridge that opened this year in March. The Kallady Bridge is also known for being an ideal location to hear the famed singing fish of Batticaloa.
name: Kallady / Lady Manning Bridge (Batticaloa)

description: A small road takes you to the beautiful beach at Kallady, which carries sombre reminders of the tragedy that struck Sri Lanka in 2004. Debris that the Boxing Day Tsunami left behind are now cordoned off by short picket fences with signs warning visitors to conduct themselves respectfully on the beach.
name: Kallady Beach (Batticaloa)

description: St Lucia's Cathedral is one of only fifteen cathedrals in the country, and it's one of the most beautiful. It is the center of the Colombo Archdiocese (Roman Catholic) and is more than 200 years old.
address: Bonjean Road, George R De Silva Mawatha, Kotahena
name: St. Lucia's Cathedral
The Floating Market
description: The Pettah Floating Market opened on the 25th of August to a lot of hype, and it's worth it. The place is another part of Colombo's fancy urban development plan along with Arcade Independence Square, but much more accessible to everyone. Colombo has never had such an amazing hangout space before, and it's affordable.

name: Colombo Gold Center
description: St John's Fishmarket in Pettah is now a Gold Center. The transformation is one part of Colombo's big urban planning picture, and as it is now, it's actually a pretty interesting place to visit.

name: Helga's Folly (Chalet Hotel)
address: Rajapihilla Mawatha, off Ampitiya Road, Kandy
description: Helga's Folly is a hotel on a hilly road in Kandy that can only be described as one very trippy experience. It used to be a family home in the 1930s and today attracts visitors who come to see its walls and rooms flooded with strange drawings and photographs.

name: Weras Ganga Park
description: The Weras Ganga park is a cool outdoors food-court in Bellanwila, one of many affordable hangout spots popping up in Colombo lately. The food is good, the range is wide, and if the weather is cool the Weras Lake next to it makes for a relaxing view.

name: Elephant Tree (Kalpitiya)
description: On our last trip to Kalpitiya, we took a boat ride out to the Elephant Tree - an ancient massive tree nestled among a beautiful lagoon of mangroves.

If you like stumbling upon places with a lot of history, then you might like a boat ride here. It's an interesting space with its ruins, its little church aisle and its twisty trees, and makes for a peaceful quiet rest by the Bay.
name: Motuwarama Dutch Church (Kalpitiya)
Kite Surfing (Kalpitiya)
description: If you're an adrenaline junkie, kite-surfing is one of the coolest ways to indulge yourself in Sri Lanka - and if you're going to give it a try, Kalpitiya is where you do it.

name: Dolphin Watching (Kalpitiya)
description: Kalpitiya is known for its beaches and its boat rides - so if you're ever there in November or December, it's the right time to go out to sea and check out the dolphins.
The Sri Dalada Maligawa or the Temple of the Tooth is one of Sri Lanka's greatest attractions - it is from the 16th century and is said to contain the canine tooth of the Buddha himself.
name: Sri Dalada Maligawa

description: St. Mary's Church is a beautiful place to visit if you're in Negombo. The stained glass and the paintings spanning the church's entire ceiling are awesome to witness, especially considering that the church goes back almost a century and a half.
name: St. Mary's Church (Negombo)

description: The YAMU office is a big A/Ced room full of reasonably nice, kind of weird people. The food appears almost once a week and the ambience is interesting.
name: The YAMU Office

description: Check out the amazeballs portrait-graffiti in Slave Island by French artist C215.
name: C215 Street Art (Slave Island)

description: The Angurukaramulla Temple is an awesome 300+ year old temple in Negombo. It's got an epic dragon's mouth entrance and also the ruins of a historic library.
name: Angurukaramulla Temple (Negombo)

description: The Negombo Fish Market is a fresh fish market, literally, on the beach shore. The endless rows of dried fish against the Negombo sky makes a startling sight.
name: Negombo Fish Market

description: The sea turtle hatchery of Hikkaduwa is a cool conservation farm for sea turtles - it's got a variety of turtle species and info about their struggle for survival.
name: Sea Turtle Hatchery (Hikkaduwa)

description: The Meeran Mosque in Galle Fort is beautiful on the inside with stained glass and lovely tiles on the floors.
name: Fort Meeran Mosque (Galle)

description: The All Saints' Church is a striking feature at the Galle Fort with its gothic columns and roof.
name: All Saints' Church (Galle)

description: The Bellanwila Raja Maha Vihara is a popular temple just outside of Colombo (Boralesgamuwa). The bodhi-tree on the temple premises is one of the thirty-two saplings from the sacred bodhi tree in Anuradhapura, distributed over 2000 years ago. It also known for its big, bright and beautiful statues and murals.
name: Bellanwila Raja Maha Vihara (Bellanwila Temple)

description: There are a lot of reasons to be at the Galle Fort rampart - from the super view of the sea and corals, to the snake charmers and guys who dive off small cliffs.
name: Galle Fort Ramparts

description: The Moon Bastion (part of the Galle Fort) is the best place to catch the sunset.
name: Moon Bastion (Galle Fort)

description: The Maritime Museum in Galle showcases a collection of boat models, maps, artillery and things found from ship-wrecks, some almost a century old.
name: National Maritime Archaeology Museum (Galle)

description: Not so much a safari as a long boat ride, sailing on the picturesque Koggala Lake is an immensely enjoyable weekend experience.
name: Koggala Lake Safari

description: Somawathi is a temple complex in Polonnaruwa district, surrounded by jungle.
address: Flood Plains National Park, Polonnaruwa District
name: Somawathi Chaitya

description: Located near Passara, Badulla, Namunukula peak is the 12th highest in Sri Lanka
name: Namunukula

description: Probably Sri Lanka's proudest monument.  The huge rock is worth a climb for any visitor.
name: Sigiriya

description: One of the lesser-known attractions of Colombo, the Maritime Museum has the potential to be interesting. For now, it is mostly dingy and poorly-lit.
address: 19, Sri Lanka Ports Authority, Chaithya Road, Colombo 1
name: Colombo Maritime Museum

description: Colombo's Public Library is pretty old and has a huge collection of books, in all three languages too. It's not one of the most inviting places in Colombo to read at, but it opens out to Viharamahadevi park where you can maybe take your library book and set up camp.
name: Colombo Public Library

description: Ravana Falls is a waterfall located near Ella, and connected with the legends of the Ramayana
name: Ravana Falls (Ella)

description: The Galle Dutch Hospital is small but super nice. It's a beautifully restored colonial building with a great and growing selection of places to eat, drink and shop.
name: Galle Dutch Hospital

description: රාවණ රජ සමයෙහි ඉදිවූ විශිෂ්ඨ ශෛලමය නිර්මාණයක මෑත යුගයේ පිබිදීමක් ලෙසින් මෙම බොල් ස්වභාවය හැඳින්විය හැකිය.
address: 16th Mile Post Junction, Ella, Uva Province
name: Ravana Cave (Ella)

description: රජුනගේ දෑතින් නිමවූ බුදු රජුනගේ ප්‍රථිමාවකි. ප්‍රථිමාවෙහි දෙපා මුල වන ගල් තලාවකි. ගල් තලාව අවසානයෙහි වන ගල් ලෙනකි. ගල් ලෙනෙ මුල්ලෙහි වන විසල් උමගකි. උමගෙහි සැඟව ගිය හෙළ රජ ඉතිහාසයකි.
address: Dova Raja Maha Viharaya, Kumbalwela, Bandarawela.
name: Dova Temple (Bandarawela)

description: Stunning Harry-Potter-esque vistas of trains and trees. Also, the Nine Arch Bridge is an iconic brick-and-stone built bridge.
name: Nine Arches Bridge (Demodara)

description: රසවත් වගේම ගුණවත් බෙලි මල් වීදුරුවක් හකුරු කෑල්ලක් සමඟ රස බලන විට ගතත් සිතත් පිනා යනුයේ අප‍්‍රමාණ ශක්තියකිනි.
name: Dunhinda Falls (Badulla)

description: Little Adam's Peak in Ella offers splendid views and a not-too-hard trek. There's a secondary peak a little way off which is even better.
name: Little Adam's Peak (Ella)

description: 1973 වර්ෂයෙහි සැප්තැම්බර් මස 05වන දින ජාතික උද්‍යානයක් ලෙසින් ප‍්‍රකාශයකට පත් මෙම භූමිය වර්ග කිලෝමීටර් 0.15කට ආසන්න වපසරියකින් යුක්ත වේ.
name: Horagolla National Park

description:
විකසිත වුවද වියළී ගියද දිය ඇල්ලක් මනරම්ද
පාමුල හිඳද මුදුනත හිඳද දිය ඇල්ලක් නරඹම්ද
address: Visaree Falls, Bambaragasyaya, Hunuketiya, Ella, Uva.
name: Visaree Falls (Bambaragasyaya)

description: From World War II Royal Air Force operations to the end of the war, the museum takes you through our aviation history.
name: Air Force Museum
Sir Lipton's Estate
description: Everything from Lipton's Seat, to Lipton's Bungalow, to the Dambatenne Factory.
සුළු වාසි, ලාභ තකා රටක ඉතිහාසය පවා පාවා දෙන විදෙස් ගැතියනට වර්තමානයෙහිදී කට උත්තර නැතිව ගොස් ඇත්තේ රට පුරා මුල් බැසගෙන ඇති 'රාවණ' රාවයත් සමඟ මතුවන අනේක විද පුරා විද්‍යාත්මක සාක්ෂි සාධක නිසාවෙනි.
name: Kurullangala Rock Art (Karandagolla)

description: දෙපා යුගල දණ හිසින් නැමී එක මත එකය. දෑත ලිහිල්ව උකුල මතය. දෑස පියවී ගොසිනි. ආශ්වාසයත් ප්‍රාශ්වාසයත් මාගේ නාස් පුඩු අගට හොඳින් දැනෙන්ට විය. ඒ උන් වහන්සේ මා හට කියා දුන් ආනා පාන සතියයි…
address: Rakkhiththa Kanda Rajamaha Viharaya, Karandagolla, Ella, Uva.
name: Rakkhiththa Kanda Hermitage (Karandagolla)

description: Bambaragama falls is the mother water fall of Ravana falls. It is at the top of Ravana falls.
name: Bambaragama Falls (Ambadandegama)

description: 'නිල් දිය පොකුණ' ඇසූ සැණින් සිරිලක බොහෝ දෙනා අතර ප්‍රසිද්ධව ඇත්තේ රාවණ පුරාවෘත්තයට සම්බන්ධ සුවිශේෂී ස්ථානයක් ලෙසිනි.
name: Nil Diya Pokuna

description: Yapahuwa was the seat of King Buvanekabahu, and one of Sri Lanka's impressively-fortified mediaeval capitals.
name: Yapahuwa

description: This rarely open museum has an interesting collection of stuff seized by the customs department, from leopard skin to ivory to bugs.
name: Customs Museum

description: ඇත්තටම මේක තනි දවසක සංචාරයක්. බඹරකන්ද දිය ඇල්ල විතරක් නෙවෙයි ලංකා ඇල්ල ඇතුළු ඝන කැළේ හැංගිලා තියෙන තවත් දිය ඇලි දෙක තුනකම සුන්දරත්වය අත්විඳින්න මේ සංචාරයෙදි පුළුවන් වෙනව.
name: Bambarakanda Falls (Kalupahana)

description: A hike in which you're guaranteed to get lost if you're going without a guide. Stunning views of Little Adam's Peak & the Ella Gap from the summit!
name: Ella Rock

description: All that's left of what we think was a seven story palace is a few high walls in stone and brick. It was built in the late 1100s but is still impressive to this day.
name: Royal Palace - Vijayotpaya/Vijayanta - (Polonnaruwa)

description: This simple clock tower has an emotional attachment for most Sri Lankans. It is also roughly kilometer zero, the distance of all major roads is calculated from the President's House next door.
address: Janadhipathi Mw and Chatham Street, Colombo 1
name: Colombo Fort Clock Tower

description: The Dutch Reformed Church is one of the oldest Protestant churches in Sri Lanka. It has beautiful honeycomb style floors inside, and has a startling collection of stone carved tombstones worked into the floors and the garden.
name: Dutch Reformed Church (Galle)
Empire Cineplex (Independence Arcade)
description: This small cinema has one hall with very comfortable lounge chairs (Gold) and another regular hall (Deluxe)

The Negombo fort is from the 17th century, back when the Dutch and Portugese tussled over Sri Lankan cinnamon trade. There's a bell tower and an archway left of it but most of the space is now a prison.
name: Negombo Fort & Lagoon

description: The rock island is basically a giant grassy land-mass in the ocean by the Mirissa beach - it's an amazing sight and an ideal spot to watch the sunset.
address: Mirissa Bay, off Matara Road, Mirissa
name: Rock Island (Mirissa)

description: The Dutch Reformed Church of Kalpitiya is one of the oldest Protestant churches in Sri Lanka - it has tombstones in its floors and back garden, and is refreshingly simple compared to your average historic Dutch church.
name: Dutch Reformed Church (Kalpitiya)

description: The Mirissa beach is arguably the cleanest, most photogenic beach on the island.
name: The Mirissa Beach

description: The Ratnagiri Temple is at the top of a little hill in Mirissa. It's a beautiful secluded space with a great view of the ocean and in-land forests.
name: Ratnagiri Hilltop Temple (Mirissa)

description: Galle Face is Colombo's most frequented public park - it's crowded but still a great place to watch the sunset, fly kites and eat isso vade.
name: Galle Face Green

description: The Sri Lanka Magic Circle is a state recognized institute of magicians that has been around since the 1920s. We learnt more about the history of magic in Sri Lanka from magician Ronald de Alwis.
name: The Sri Lanka Magic Circle

description: Ruwanweliseya is the most venerated and well-known stupa in Sri Lanka
name: Ruwanweliseya

description: සොබා දහමෙහි අපූර්වත්වයත් එහි ආශ්වාදයත් කුඩා කල සිටම මැනවින් දත් තෝමස් කඳු කරය පීරා මුහුදු මට්ටමේ සිට අඩි 5000කට ආසන්න උසකින් පිහිටි හපුතලේ, තංගමලේ ප්‍රදේශයෙන් උස් කඳු ගැටයක් මත වන තරමක් විශාල තැනිතලා භූමියක් සොයා ගත්තේය.
name: Adisham Bungalow (Haputale)

description: හීනි වැහි පොදයක්, මිහිදුමක් හැරෙන්න මුළු මනින්ම හිරු කිරණින් දිස්න දෙන මේ වන අරණ කුරුල්ලන්ගෙ කීචි බීචියෙන්, ලස්සන සමනලුන්ගෙ හැඩ වැඩෙන් අලංකරණය වෙලා තියෙන්නෙ පරිසර හිතකාමී ඔයාල වෙනුවෙන්මයි.
name: Lanka Falls (Kalupahana)
Sail Lanka Charter (Sailing In Pasikuda)
description: Here's a guide to going sailing on a yacht and snorkeling in Pasikuda, thanks to Sail Lanka - and it's surprisingly not too pricey either.
The Mari Amma Kovil is a small, beautiful Hindu temple in Pasikuda that's about seven centuries old. It's still in very good condition, attracting devotees of mostly Goddesses Mari and Kali.
name: Mari Amma Kovil (Pasikuda)
Yala National Park (Safari)
description: Yala is Sri Lanka's wildlife central, and thousands of people flock the National Park every year for a chance to spot wildlife, especially the elusive Lankan leopard.
The National Postal Museum is a surprisingly well maintained collection elaborately detailing Sri Lanka's ...well you guessed it - postal history.
address: Postal Headquarters,  No 310, D . R .  Wijewardena Mw, Colombo 10
name: National Postal Museum

description: The Elephant Rock is a nice, sort-of-private beach in Pasikuda, marked by a small elephant shaped rock, with plenty of shore to chill on unlike most of Pasikuda now.
name: Elephant Rock (Pasikuda)

description: Lipton's Seat, located in Dambethenna Estate in Haputhale, has amazing panoramic views and is a worthwhile hike.
name: Lipton's Seat (Haputale)

description: N'Eliya is one of the best vacation destinations to get away from the city and relax, and taking a walk through the Victoria Park is one of the best ways to do just that.
name: Victoria Park (Nuwara Eliya)

description: The Japanese Peace Pagoda near Unawatuna is a beautiful shrine with amazing views across the ocean. It's also quite near Jungle Beach.
name: Japanese Peace Pagoda (Unawatuna)

description: This is the oldest Hindu temple in Colombo, by most accounts. It's in a hidden location just off D.R. Wijewardena Mw and is a pleasant and welcoming kovil to visit.
name: Captain's Garden Kovil (Sri Kailasanathar Swami Devashthanam)

description: This lonely island/isthmus just before Tangalle is a beautiful spot, well worth a stop as you're driving down the coast. At low tide (around sunset) you can walk/wade across a spit of land and be surrounded by sea and beauty on all sides.
name: Tangalla Bay
Otter's Aquatic Club
address: Otter Aquatic Club, Colombo, 380/1, Bauddhaloka Mawatha, Colombo 8
description: Apart from its pool, Otter's strikes this delightful yet confusing mix between being simultaneously family-friendly and being a good place for chaps after work to put a manly arrack session.

name: Kitulgala White Water Rafting (Ceylon Adventures)
description: Kitulgala is Sri Lanka's white water rafting central because of its access to the Kelani river. We stayed at Ceylon Adventures where we rafted, trekked and slid down mini waterfalls.
Casuarina Beach is the go-to beach for Jaffna locals. Don't expect a bikinis-and-beers sort of scene.
name: Casuarina Beach (Jaffna)
Cinnamon Air – Sigiriya Flight
address: Bandaranaike International Airport, Katunayake, Sri Lanka
description: If you’re looking for a quick way to get across the country in luxury with a view you can’t find anywhere else, Cinnamon Air is your best bet.

name: Yal Devi
description: The Yal Devi is a part of history. It's by no means a quick or luxurious way to the North or back, but it's an interesting journey. It's hot, vibrant and slow - a proper Sri Lankan voyage.
Independence Square is a beautiful place to hang out and relax. A lot of people surprisingly don't know that under the Memorial Hall are wooden doors that open into a museum.
name: Independence Memorial Museum

description: The early 17th Century Jaffna Fort was built by the Portuguese, expanded by the Dutch, and destroyed by human aggression. Visit the ruins - a testament to architectural prowess and sheer brutality.
name: Jaffna Fort
Lunuganga (Bentota)
description: Geoffrey Bawa's impact on Sri Lanka is unparalleled. His legacy as an architect and writer is etched in local history. Lunuganga is arguably the most famous of his works, a country home set in a sprawling lakeside garden estate.
The Sambodhi Chaithya is a beautiful temple built on top of two impressive intersecting concrete arches.
name: Sambodhi Chaithya

description: The Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage is one of the most popular excursions and tourist destinations since it's inception back in 1975. It's a rare opportunity to get up close and personal with the elephants, which makes for a memorable experience.
name: Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage

description: The temple raised on platforms on the Beira Lake is probably the most beautiful place in the neighborhood - it's a beautiful and unexpected piece of art that was designed by Geoffrey Bawa and funded by S. H. Moosajee in the 1970s.
address: Beira Lake, Sri James Pieris Mawatha, Colombo 2
name: Seema Malaka Temple

description: Gangaramaya Temple isn't just a temple - it's about 150 years old and half of its space is cluttered with museum artifacts and old junk like wrist watches.
name: Gangaramaya Temple

description: Beira Lake is a nice place to chill out on a cool day - it's a hot spot for couples but there's a great view for anyone to enjoy here especially at night when it's lit up.
address: Beira Lake, James Pieris Mawatha, Colombo 2
name: Beira Lake

description: The German Toy Museum is Gayangi von Heimendahl's personal collection of toys - dolls, cars, train sets, you name it - from Germany, over the span of 35 years.
name: German Toy Museum

description: Meemure is an isolated village in the Knuckles range in Kandy. It's rich in natural beauty.
name: Meemure

description: Arcade Independence Square is yet another super-complex of eateries and shopping outlets to pop up in Colombo since the Racecourse buildings. It's got its own food court, a bunch of places to buy clothes and eat at, and is cushioned on a beautiful green expanse.
name: Arcade Independence Square

description: The Kathiresan kovil or Puthiya (new) Kathiresan kovil is a beautiful one easily recognizable from Galle Road in Bambalapitiya -the temple is dedicated to the war God Skanda or Murugan.
name: New Kathiresan Kovil (Bambalapitiya)
Strikes Cosmic Bowling
address: Excel World, 338 T.B Jayah Mawatha, Colombo 10
description: This bowling alley in Excel World is nothing fancy, but fun enough.
Pettah is Colombo's biggest, most functional market space. It's loud, crowded and infinitely full of interesting and useful things - it's one of those places you either love or you hate.
name: Pettah (A Guide)

description: The Dewatagaha mosque is one of the more prominent mosques in Colombo - its lovely exterior is almost an iconic part of the architecture near Town Hall. It is also partly a shrine to a Saint from the 19th century - Shaikh Usman Waliyullah - and Muslims and non-Muslims alike visit to pay their respects.
address: Dr C. W. W. Kannangara Mawatha, Colombo 7
name: Dewatagaha Mosque (Shaikh Usman Waliyullah Shrine)

description: Peradeniya's gardens now titled 'Royal Botanical Gardens' is probably the most popular garden in the country. It spreads through 147 acres and is said to attract close to 2 million visitors every year. It is a glorious expanse of well-kept trees, flowers and pathways, some of which are centuries old.
name: Royal Botanical Gardens (Peradeniya)
Cinnamon Air - Kandy Flight
address: Waters Edge, 316, Polduwa Rd, Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte
description: You can now go from Colombo to Kandy in 20 minutes if you take the Cinnamon Air sea plane. The view is amazing and it's pretty punctual; the only hold-up if at all is that a one-way ticket will cost you about Rs. 22K (a lot).
If you're around Kandy, you might want to stop by the National Seminary in Ampitiya - a beautiful expanse of old buildings and wild trees, home to young would-be priests.
name: The National Seminary (Ampitiya)

description: There's a lovely new aquarium at Diyatha Uyana, the site of the Good Market, near Water's Edge. Each tank is run by a different fish store. It's not Sea World, but it's still a worthwhile stroll in a circle.
name: Diyatha Uyana Aquarium (Battaramulla)

description: Whiskey Point is a quite surfable and moderately swimmable point about 12 km from Arugam Bay. It's a bit of a trek, but worth it for some great waves and the chill cafe/hotel SaBaBa's.
address: Whiskey Point, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province
name: Whiskey Point

description: The Weerawila Lake is located along the A2, the Galle Road, but well past Galle and Hambantota, as the road begins to head up to the hills. It's notable because the road cuts right through the lake, giving you stunning views and a quite pleasant drive.
name: Weerawila Lake

description: Main Point is the most accessible surf spot in Arugam Bay and it has something for surfers, swimmers and loungers alike.
name: Main Point (Arugam Bay)
Hustler's Paintball (Hanwella)
description: Hustler's Paintball is a bit out there but it offers a great paintball experience with expert guidance, good gear and a built in river bath afterwards.
The Central Point is a completely refurbished building behind Dutch Hospital, run by the Central Bank. It's a beautiful space which now houses a money museum and a cafe.
name: Central Point (Economic History Museum)

description: The Nelum Pokuna Mahinda Rajapaksa Theatre is beautiful on the outside but a bit cheap on the inside. Still worth a visit.
name: Nelum Pokuna
The Om Space
description: The Om Space is a yoga studio located off Havelock Road, near the Royal Institute.
Viharamahadevi Park, known earlier as Victoria Park, is Colombo's only central park. It's been done-up for quite a while now and it looks great, especially in the evenings.
name: Viharamahadevi Park

description: Near the Palm Villa, there's a nice swimmable beach and a big climbable rock.
name: Palm Villa Beach (Mirissa)
Dondra Head Lighthouse
description: Octagonal in shape with quaint yellow windows set against brick painted white, the Dondra Lighthouse stands fifty metres tall at the edge of a shady and well-kept garden

At the end of Main Street, Pettah, there is a forgotten museum. The Old Town Hall Museum houses a variety of very heavy memorabilia from the city's past - steam-rollers, street signs, printing presses, manhole covers. It's both mundane and wonderful, housed in an open and elegant space, ignored by the swirling commerce around.
name: The Old Town Hall Museum

description: On the side of Baseline Road in Narahenpita there's a wall mural depicting hell/the underworld and all the terrible torments that await (beheadings, eye pokings, punching in the stomach). If you're stopped in traffic it's kinda amazing.
name: Hell Wall (Narahenpita)

description: The Batticaloa Science Museum is not a very good museum and it smells funny (probably because of the generally live sea creatures in tanks) but it's interesting in its own way.
name: Museum Of Natural History And Science (Batticaloa)

description: Jungle Beach is a secluded beach in Unawatuna that's growing less secluded all the time. It's still a nice and relatively peaceful Una beach off the main strip.
name: Jungle Beach (Unawatuna)
Kosgoda Sea Turtle Conservation Project
description: Turtle hatcheries are good for the environment, save lives, and incredibly fun. There are a few lovely ones down the coast, especially in and around the Kosgoda area. We visited the Kosgoda Sea Turtle Conservation Project this weekend.

name: Whale Watching Mirissa With Geeth
description: Geeth has a small boat which keeps you close to the action - sightings of whales, dolphins and immersion in the great expanse of the ocean.

name: Cinnamon Air - Batticaloa Flight
description: Cinnamon Air's flight to Batticaloa is the best way to get there. It's also pretty expensive. If you can afford it, do it.

name: Hambegamuwa Lake
description: If you have a penchant for birds, nature and general chilling on a canoe, this is the place to be.
If you're into history, this 1757 church is an important part of Colombo. It's heavy, lasting architecture that they don't make anymore and we think it's worth a visit.
name: Wolvendaal Church (Christian Reformed)

description: Roughly 10 kilometres from the centre of Colombo, the Kelaniya Temple is one of the most well known Buddhist temples in the Colombo area and, in my opinion, one of the most beautiful in Sri Lanka. Built on the banks of the Kelani River, (which flows from Sri Pada/Adam's Peak), the temple is said to be particularly sacred, as the Buddha visited the site on his third visit to Sri Lanka.
name: Kelaniya Raja Maha Vihara (Kelaniya Temple)

description: This is a great beach if you’re looking for a secluded place to chill out and watch the sunset, etc. You can also bring your car right up to the sand at some points, so it makes for a great seaside picnic setting too.
name: Uswetakeiyawa Beach
Water World & Bird Park (Kelaniya)
description: Water World is South Asia’s first underwater tunnel aquarium and is the only public aquarium in Sri Lanka. Despite the name, the attraction is actually a combination of two parks, the aquarium and a bird park.

Clean and untouched Kadiyanlena/Kataboola falls is truly an amazing place to visit. It is quite famous among local waterfall hunters and a must see place if you are a nature lover. Kadiyanlena is located in Nawalapitiya, precisely in Kadiyanlena village. This is near Hatton, Nuwara Eliya and Kandy.
name: Kadiyanlena Falls (Nawalapitiya)

description: A couple of years ago the once gentle gathering of music lovers turned into something of a socialite scene, overrun by adolescents ducking for cigarettes behind plastic chairs and the chatter of patrons bubbling over the smooth, sashaying sounds of the sax.
name: Sunday Jazz At CR&FC

description: Even if you have nothing to to do with Anglicanism St Peters is fully worth visiting as one the city's oldest and most attractive buildings. An amazing and long-forgotten space that  quite desperately needs to be visited and loved again.
name: St Peters Church - Mission To Seafarers

description: The Planetarium is one of those places in Colombo that's stayed more or less the same since 1965, give or take a bit of furniture revamping and their new website. The building still looks fantastic, the feeling you get when the lights dim is still exciting, most of the graphics are unfortunately still outdated, and the ticket is still just cheap.
name: Sri Lanka Planetarium

description: Located in the outskirts of Colombo, Attidiya Bird Sanctuary is a small land (may be the only place near Colombo) for the birds and other animals to take refuge in. I was surprised at the biodiversity which I encountered for a place that is right in the backyard of Colombo city.
name: Attidiya Bird Sanctuary

description: The Southern Expressway opened two gleaming service stations near Welipenna. Each houses a Cargills Food City and assorted shops like Juiceez, Dinemore, Gihan's, Gill's, Pascucci and New Monis. They also have ATMs and quite decent bathrooms.
name: Southern Expressway Service Area (Canonwin Arcade)

description: Just being able to stand in a space that someone from the 17th century would still recognize is worth the Rs 20  admission charge.
name: Dutch Period Museum

description: Overcome any superstitions about graveyards you might harbor  and step in.
name: Jawatte Cemetery

description: The lighthouse provides stunning views of the Indian Ocean. From its raised base you can see all the way down the Galle Face Green to the Galle Face Hotel and right across to the very tip of the horizon.
name: Galle Buck Lighthouse

description: It looks like England's lake district or New Zealand. In fact Ambewala's marketing tag is - little New Zealand, and unlike certain little Rome's and Englands we have in this country the name isn't a flight a fancy;
name: Ambewala Farm

description: The wetland park has quite literally changed the face of the town overnight. From its former existence as an unlovely tangle of ill-planned shops and houses, there's finally something pretty in Nugegoda - somewhere to go besides the trifecta of trash McDonalds, Pizza Hut or KFC.
name: Urban Wetland Park (Nugegoda)
Diyawanna Boat Rides
description: The Diyawanna Ferry Service (actually a boat service) run by the Sri Lanka Navy is an excellent new addition to the diversions available to Colombars and visitors. It is the best way to see Sri Lanka’s Parliament from all angles, since the boat does a full circle of the iconic Bawa building.

The colonial forts of Sri Lanka are a highlight for many tourists. The charming city of Galle Fort has been wonderfully restored while Jaffna’s fort sits in ruin, allowing visitors to haphazardly climb over stones. Having visited most of the forts in the country, my favorite is Fort Frederick in Trincomalee
name: The Temples Of Fort Frederick

description: Flower Shows at Water’s Edge Park
address: Waters Edge Limited 316, Ethul Kotte Road , Battaramulla , Sri Lanka.
name: The Flower Market (Battaramulla)

description: The jogging track opposite the Sri Lankan Parliament (Japan Friendship Road) has been a marvelous success at gathering large crowds of people. Covering a distance of 1880M, it is probably the longest track in the vicinity of Colombo, not to mention one of the most picturesque; solar powered lights span the length of the course creating a beautiful skyline by night.
name: Diyawanna Jogging Track

description: The Portuguese called it Ilha das Vacas, the Dutch called it Delft, and the locals call it Neduntivu. Located in the Palk Strait, southwest of Jaffna, Delft is a relatively undiscovered tourist destination, ideal if you're interested in Sri Lankan history or sandy, white beaches
name: Delft (Neduntivu) Island
Premadasa Riding School
description: The Premadasa Riding School is a nice place to learn how to ride horses, swim, and to play badminton or squash. All hidden away in Nugegoda.

name: Adam's Bridge Boat Tours
description: Adam's Bridge, which separates the Gulf of Mannar from the Palk Strait, is a string of sand islands, that once connected Talaimannar to Rameswaram Island in India.
Fitness First sits on top of the HSBC bank and the Reebok showroom opposite Avirate Cafe. Located in convenient Colombo 7, it’s a fitness spa with a gym, swimming pool, Jacuzzi and sauna
name: Fitness First Gym
Lifestyle Gym
address: Sir Marcus Fernando Mawatha, Colombo 07, Sri Lanka
description: The lifestyle gym is a part of the SLTA building (Sri Lanka Tennis Association) and has been one of Colombo’s ancient and more popular gyms for more than two decades. It also happens to be one of the smallest gyms in Colombo, but over the years Lifestyle has evolved from a gym to a comprehensive centre for fitness and health.

name: Body Bar Gym
description: The Body Bar gym sits down Jawatte Avenue (Jawatte Road) in Colombo 7. It seems to be quite quite popular with folks in Colombo - it's clean and there's a sense of homeliness that you look for in a gym. The trainers speak pretty good English and were really helpful when I asked for a tour of the place.

name: Royal College Gym
description: The Royal College Gym is found in the Royal College Sports Complex, home to Royal ruggerites and sportsmen alike. The complex comprises of the famous rugby field (this is where the Bradby takes place), an indoor basketball court, badminton courts, volleyball court, squash courts, a netball court, a boxing ring and of course - the Royal Gym.

name: Speedrome
address: 260/1, Pannipitiya Road, Pelawatta, Battaramulla, Sri Lanka.
description: CLOSED: Speed Drome in Battaramulla, as far as I know, is the only place for pro karting in close proximity to Colombo. They used to have a smaller circuit in Excel World (AKA Millenium Park before)  but it looks like they’ve sold their go karts for scrap metal leaving Speed Drome the only place for an injection of speed.
Many Colomboars aren't aware this historical building exists, but it still stands.
name: General Post Office

description: What makes this particular temple so attractive is its relative lack of adornment and extraneous features.
name: Metharamaya Temple

description: This is really a wonderful place for a late afternoon stroll, and it's so busy and well alive with activity that even the most squeamish or superstitious Colombar could hardly be afraid to wander in.
name: Borella Cemetery

description: Mount Lavinia Beach is Sri Lanka's main sea-bathing spot. Here, depending on season, the waves can be swimmable and it's host to some amazing sunsets. Note, however, that this is not a bay like Unawatuna. The waters is swimmable only at certain times of the year and can be very rough, with undertow. If no one else is swimming, don't swim.
name: Mount Lavinia Beach

address: Majestic City, Galle Road, Bambalapitiya, Colombo 4
name: P. G. Martin Wonderworld (Majestic City)

description: The Sampath Bank Super Branch on Dharmapala Mawatha is a bank open at useful hours. It's open from 7 AM to 10 PM, 365 days a year.
name: Sampath Bank Super Branch

description: Tucked away in one of the often over-looked valleys surrounding Hatton, Castlereagh Reservoir isn’t a major tourist attraction, however if you were anywhere else it the world it would be.
name: Castlereagh Reservoir

description: Shailabembarama Maha Viharaya (Dodanduwa) is one the finest of the island' Southern temples. The image house has fine examples of temple murals/paintings. I got 'lost' in the image house, documenting the work on the walls.
address: Shailabembarama Maha Viharaya, Dodanduwa, Sri Lanka
name: Shailabimbaramaya Temple (Dodanduwa)

description: There is a coastal road from Colombo to Negombo which, while not especially fast, is really quite scenic and worth a drive. It begins as you take the bridge out of Mattakuliya and proceed along the canal. It then continues along the coast all the way to Negombo.
name: The Old Colombo/Negombo Road

description: Bankhill Wellness Studio is located in the Olympic House right next to Independence Square. This hidden house of weights sits on top of Fortune Boat and it happens to be the cheapest and grimiest gym we’ve reviewed yet.
address: Olympic House, No. 100/9F, Independence Avenue, Colombo 7
name: Bankhill Wellness | Olympic House Mini Studio

description: Ridi Vihara means silver temple. It was built by King Dutugemunu on the site of a great silver ore deposit. That silver was used for the Ruwanwelisaya stupa in Anuradhapura, but the temple here is still quite a sight.
name: Ridi Vihara (Photos By Dominic Sansoni)

description: The ‘rukada’ figures have been handcrafted by traditional puppet artists with remarkable attention to detail.
name: Traditional Puppet Art Museum

description: A short walk on the ramparts is a must to enjoy the spectacular view of the Batticaloa Lagoon and the few Dutch-era cannons that remain.
name: Batticaloa Fort

description: Waters Edge is a splash of paradise in Colombo’s Concrete Jungle - located in Battaramulla, it’s a rich oasis with much lush greenery and some breathtaking views of the Diyawanna Lake.
name: Waters Edge Gym

description: High Octane Fitness is found in Pamankada, pretty close to The Dutch Burger and Shiraz on Stratford Avenue. It is the best gym in Sri Lanka, need I say more?
name: High Octane Fitness Gym

description: OSMO Fitness in Battaramulla is an all round sports centre, in progress. They have a pretty great gym here, and tennis, badminton and squash courts. A 50m swimming pool is said to be on its way, but I think this might take at least another year to finish.
name: OSMO Fitness

description: St Andrews has actually always been something of another world. This was the planter’s church built by homesick Scottish tea-planters in 1842 and traditionally the congregation was predominantly European. Its attractive simplicity makes it a real contender for most beautiful church in Colombo.
name: St. Andrew's Scots Kirk

description: The park is perched above the Mount Lavinia Hotel and the ocean. It's a serene public space where you can hear and smell the sea but still be surrounded by green. They have a huge lawn, ample playground equipment, a full basketball court and even a small lending library.
name: Mount Lavinia Children's Park

description: The National Art Gallery essentially consists of two long, rectangular halls - one containing the gallery's permanent collection and the other displaying temporary exhibitions by Sri Lankan artists. It's an interesting place with some very interesting works, but it's not really what you'd expect from a national gallery.
address: 106 Ananda Coomaraswamy Mawatha, Cinnamon Gardens, Colombo 7
name: The National Art Gallery

description: This is a sorta wall monument to... the truth. We think. This is a plaque in Borella which reads:The Foundation Of The Truth: The objective of the foundation is to establish irrefutable knowledge.
name: The Foundation Of The Truth

description: Once you get there (following our tips), the experience is awesome. Not to be missed. Nothing beats a tense Sri Lanka cricket game, and the show is good even when Sri Lanka isn't playing.
name: R. Premadasa Stadium

description: පරිගණක ක්‍රීඩා කරමුද? ‍‍කොහුවල හන්දියේ Cafe Vortex එකට යමු!
address: No 10, Sunethra Devi Road, Kohuwala, Nugegoda
name: Cafe Vortex

description: There's a farm in the Bandaranaika Memorial International Conference Hall grounds. I know that sounds odd as the BMICH is the nation's principal conference center and located in the center of Colombo, so not really what you'd think of an as agricultural spot, but nevertheless someone has installed rows of fruit trees, vegetable plots and even a cattle shed with a few cows in it.
name: BMICH Model Farm

description: The Nelum Pokuna Art Street is Colombo's only or at least oldest 'street art' space: a long pavement stretch of paintings by local artists, opposite Viharamahadevi Park, frequented by art enthusiasts and tourists.
name: Nelum Pokuna Art Street

description: Well you really can’t do one without the other - Mount Lavinia Hotel and the Galle Face Hotel are Colombo’s colonial duo. So we headed to the GFH’s famed salt water pool. That’s right, no chlorine here, but salt so you get a bit of added buoyancy and less of that horrid chorine smell.
name: Galle Face Hotel (Pool)

description: Of Colombo’s 5 star hotel pools we are partial to the one at Cinnamon Lakeside. It’s probably the most  recently refurbished of the big hotel pools and with its Beira-side views, deep blue tinge, and innovative U-shape it makes for better swimming than your average hotel pool.
address: 115, Sir Chittampalam A. Gardiner Mawatha, Colombo 2
name: Cinnamon Lakeside (Pool)

description: Sea bathing at Mount Lavinia was an old colonial tradition and for over a century the Mt Lavinia hotel has been the place for an afternoon swim. The swimming pool itself is a modern creation and, well, it’s fine, but not stunning in any way.
address: Mount Lavinia Hotel, Hotel Road, Mount Lavinia
name: Mount Lavinia Hotel (Pool)

description: This tiny memorial to Sri Wickrama Rajasingha in the Ceylinco parking lot is a quirky destination.
name: The Last King's Jail Cell

description: We've been looking forward to the opening of the refurbished Racecourse Grounds in Cinnamon Gardens. The old Dutch Hospital in Fort was renovated by the same authorities recently and they pretty much got it spot on, turning it into a lovely courtyard encircled by good restaurants and shops. Since the derelict Race Course was being done up under the same peeps, we expected it to turn out like Dutch Hos - ie. awesome.
address: Race Course Ground, Reid Avenue, Colombo 7
name: The Colombo Racecourse

description: Independence Square is still a great place to relax in Colombo. It's part monument, part park, part walking ground. It's main function seems to be as the place where Colombars go for their evening constitutional (walk).
name: Independence Square
The Colombo Swimming Club
description: It’s called the swimming club, so this ought to be a good place for a swim - and it is. Apart from splashing it out in the pool, you can also dive into their excellent club-level food.
This interesting temple in interesting Kotahena is a unique blend of Thai, colonial and local architecture. It's also the oldest Buddhist temple in Colombo.
address: Deepaduttaramaya, Kotahena Street and Mayfield, Kotahena
name: Deepaduttaramaya Temple

description: The new Savoy 3D cinema is just...wow. It's huge, the seats aren't falling apart and the screen is HD. That's right, no more trembling, blurry projections. Just a crystal clear, blazingly vibrant, enormous screen.
address: 12 Savoy Building,  Galle Road, Wellawatte, Colombo 6
name: Savoy 3D Cinema

description: The Dehiwala Zoo is kind of depressing if you're an animal lover, ironically, because a lot of the animals live in sad situations here. Some of the animals have wider greener spaces to live in now though.
name: Dehiwala Zoo

description: Viharamahadevi Park (VMDP) is Colombo's only major public park.  As such it’s a rather important place, providing the sole significant green space and lung for the city's 1 million + inhabitants.
name: Viharamahadevi Park (Old)

description: A lovely little mountain range just off Kandy.
name: Hantane

description: The Sri Ponnambalawaneswaram Kovil or the Sivan Kovil is a superb, stone Kovil in Kochchikade close to St. Anthony's church.
name: Sivan Kovil (Kotahena)

description: Also known as Sri Pada, Adam's Peak isn't just a mountain, it's also laden with religous connotations for many Sri Lankans,
name: Adam's Peak
Pidurangala
address: Pidurangala Rock, Sigiriya Rd, Central Province
description: A fun and challenging scramble up a rock to see Everything.

name: Earl’s Passikudah
description: The warm reception we received on arriving at Earl's was an early indication of how good a time we were going to have there.  Only a short walk away from Passikudah beach, this friendly and comfortable little hotel will serve you well.
The Asokaramaya temple in Thimbirigasyaya is well over 100 years old and houses some beautiful statues and paintings.
name: Asokaramaya Temple
Sri Lanka Karting Circuit , Bandaragama
description: Hidden in some off-road track in Badaragama is a full on Go-Kart circuit developed by the David Pieris Motor Company that launched back in 2013.  They also offer other leisure activities like Air-Rifle shooting, a swimming pool amidst other things so we decided to pack up and head there to experience the adrenaline rush.
This is apparently the largest pink quartz mountain range in South East/ South Asia.
address: Madatugama - Pubbogama - Andiyagala Road, Sri Lanka
name: Rose Quartz Mountain Range at Jathika Namal Uyana

description: An ancient forest monastery in the middle of a forest.
name: Ritigala Forest Monastery

description: Madu river is a unique environmental setup in Balapitiya; South West Sri Lanka.
name: Madu River
